newsitem.title: USA: ConAgra sees earnings growth on target.
newsitem.headline: ConAgra sees earnings growth on target.

text.p: ConAgra Inc, a diversified food company, said on Thursday its increased dividend reflects confidence that earnings per share are growing at the targeted rate of 14 percent or more.
Earlier, ConAgra raised its dividend by 14.7 percent to $0.2725 a share from $0.2375.

"ConAgra's dividend policy is to increase our common stock dividend consistent with growth in our company's trend line earnings," Philip Fletcher, chairman, said in a statement. "This dividend increase reflects our confidence that ConAgra's trend line earnings per share are growing at our objective rate of 14-plus percent."
On September 19, ConAgra said it expects double-digit earnings growth for fiscal 1997. It reported first quarter to August 25 earnings that day of $0.42 a share, up from $0.36 a year ago.
